flow.descriptionCdata:
2a4c493c-eb95-4a06-afd6-f1cd3c429870.2cc1ff35-8158-41e3-aa67-68f85ea39493.description=Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null. Inputs\: keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable. Returns\: The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable. Responses\: isNull - if the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value. notNull - if some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned. 2a4c493c-eb95-4a06-afd6-f1cd3c429870.78b80827-ee4d-413a-b319-6d9a0542abde.description=
Runs a SQL command.
Does not return any results (only whether the command was executed)

Input Parameters\:
DBServerName - hostname or ip address of db server
DBPort - the port to connect to (Defaults - Oracle\: 1521, MSSQL\: 1433, Sybase\: 5000, Netcool\: 4100, DB2\: 50000)
Database - the name of the database
Command - the command to execute
DbType - (Oracle, MSSQL, Sybase, Netcool, DB2, Custom) type of database to connect to (if custom see the note below)
Username - sql or windows user to connect as
Password -  sql or windows user account password
authenticationType - (Sql, Windows) the type of authentication used to access the database (applicable only to MSSQL DbType); if empty, the Sql authentication will be used by default

Responses\:
success - the command was executed successfully
failure - the command could not be executed

Extra Results\:
updateCount - the update count of the command executed

NOTE\: 
By default, this op supports Oracle, MSSql, DB2, Sybase.  
To enable MySQL support, the JDBC drivers would need to be added to the %ICONCLUDE_HOME%\RAS\Java\Default\webapp\WEB-INF\lib directory and then update the SQLDBType selection list with the appropriate setting (MySQL). 
To enable Netcool support, the JDBC driver (jconn2.jar) would need to be added to the %ICONCLUDE_HOME%\RAS\Java\Default\webapp\WEB-INF\lib directory and then update the SQLDBType selection list with the appropriate setting (Netcool)

CUSTOM NOTE\:
If you want to use a custom JDBC driver than you must have the library installed as noted above.  Also, you will need add two new inputs to the operation\:
dbClass - the classname of the JDBC driver to use
dbURL - the url required to load up the driver and make your connection
For Windows authentication, the domain must be specified in dbURL and dbClass must point to a MSSQL driver.
For Sql authentication, the domain must not be specified in dbURL. 

DB2 NOTE\: 
The DB2 commands should not be followed by ';'. Every time a table name is needed, it will be used in commands preceded by the name of the schema. So, every time a table is to be used, TABLE_NAME should be replaced by SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME.

ORACLE NOTE\:
It is possible to run PL/SQL procedures using this operation. The examples below present the syntax to be used for having the same efect as the following PL/SQL script\: 
BEGIN
send_message(addressee\=>'b@hp.com',sender\=>'pas@hp.com',subject\=>'Test',message\=>'Test');
END;

Example 1\: BEGIN send_message(addressee\=>'b@hp.com',sender\=>'pas@hp.com',subject\=>'Test',message\=>'Test');END;

Example 2\: BEGIN send_message('b@hp.com','pas@hp.com','Test','Test');END;

Example 3\: {CALL send_message(addressee\=>'b@hp.com',sender\=>'pas@hp.com',subject\=>'Test',message\=>'Test')}

Example 4\: {CALL send_message('b@hp.com','pas@hp.com','Test','Test')}
2a4c493c-eb95-4a06-afd6-f1cd3c429870.9e98be0a-4c85-4364-a7da-01fec0adeeb5.description=

2a4c493c-eb95-4a06-afd6-f1cd3c429870.description=
Updates Impact when a case needs to be rejected to the browser because OO failed to clear the trap.

Inputs\:
serverSerial- server serial from  the trap
serverName- server name from the trap
status- set to FAILURE to tell Impact to return to browser
journalEntry- what to enter in the trap's journal
ticket- case id of the case whose status is 'Open - Pending Disco'

Outputs\:
returnResult - the return result value of the flow .

Responses\:
success - If everything went fine.
failure - If something went wrong.

flow.name: RejectTrapToBrowser_NoFailure

scriptlet.name: Step:ValidateJournalEntry Flow:RejectTrapToBrowser_NoFailure (4865c8da-235b-4db4-9388-8d113172fa42)

staticBinding.value: update Forward_Event_Status set resolvedDate = GETUTCDATE(), status = '${status}' where serverSerial = ${serverSerial} and serverName = '${serverName}'
insert into Forward_Event_Values (serverSerial, serverName, parameterName, parameterValue) VALUES (${serverSerial}, '${serverName}', 'Journal',${journalEntry})
insert into Forward_Event_Values (serverSerial, serverName, parameterName, parameterValue) VALUES (${serverSerial}, '${serverName}', 'TicketId', '${ticket}')
insert into Forward_Event_Values (serverSerial, serverName, parameterName, parameterValue) VALUES (${serverSerial}, '${serverName}', 'TicketSystem', 'Vantive')
